intro: Gorteria ictinus, commonly known as the Cape bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is a perennial herb that produces small, oval leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Gorteria ictinus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
